website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix P330 pocket camera is capable of producing some truly outstanding images, but may be too slow for some shooters.
pros: Very small for a 1/1.7-inch sensor camera
cons: Extreme distortion at widest angle in Raw mode

customer_reviews.title: All the features of a big DSLR but this one is in your pocket when you need it.
customer_reviews.text: First rate P&S camera. I've been using one for several years, and have taken some amazing photos with it. Fast lens (f/1.8) and 5X zoom and RAW capability and image stabilization give good photos even in low light and other challenging conditions. Has all the features of the big DSLR's, but this one is in your pocket, while the big DSLR is at home.
customer_reviews.author: JaytheGeek

customer_reviews.title: Will I use my DSLR again?
customer_reviews.text: After traveling with an expensive and heavy DSLR that I left in my room a bit too often, I decided that on my next trip I would bring a light camera that could ride along in my pocket. There are a lot of options and reviews out there.... heaven knows what the best choice is. That being said, I am very satisfied with this camera. Image quality is excellent, particularly in low light situations. Menus are a bit quirky, and the on-off switch sometimes seems to have a mind of its own.
customer_reviews.author: Blossom

customer_reviews.title: Impeccable Image Quality!! Extremely Compact!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and educator—in the field for over 20 years, and in the classroom for the last 4. I have been looking for a "compact" point and shoot camera that processes a RAW image file. The P330 is that and more. Truly "pocketable" and the image quality from a fully processed RAW file is impeccable. I had looked at the P7100, 7000 and others. The size and weight of those units take them out of the "pocket–point & shoot" variety very quickly, and the large sensor CoolPix A is not cost effective. This camera P330) has all the functionality I need in the palm of my hands. I love it. . . . bgs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob GlickSmith

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with great value and function in a small camera
customer_reviews.text: ordered mine used, but couldn't be happier with it. Looks new to me - no noticeable cosmetic flaws. It has worked flawlessly so far. Love option to get RAW files from such a small package. Low light capabilities make it great in museums and other indoor settings. Sometimes does seem to take a while to process/save when taking RAW with JPG shots - could be a card speed issue - using a class 10 card, but not the higher speed "pro" cards so far - may need to try one. Other wise a great little picture machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Nikon camera. I am very pleased. Very nice features and programs for a pocket camera. The software is very user friendly. The battery has enough power to last all day. On vacation recently I probably made 40-50 shots per day. It has a program for almost every lighting and action level that makes it really easy to just point and shoot. However you must accept that an auto focus has it's limitations in extreme situations. You must lightly press the shutter button on each shot and give it time to focus. in dim light you may need to do it 2-3 times until it focuses correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Hollis

customer_reviews.title: typical Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research, for originally Fuji was the leader in making pocket digital cameras, but Nikon has done it again! The P330 is flat-out the best digital pocket camera on the market. True, some others have much longer zooms, but ALL zoom lenses have to compromise resolution. What Nikon does is supply a large backlit CMOS sensor, which means you can zoom the file later. Further, the P330 is the only pocket digital camera that makes manual operation practical. Sure, the auto features are superb, but every serious photographer has to resort to manual now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Pleased, would buy another
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. see kenrockwell.com -- a bit slow to turn on, after being spoiled by D40 and even faster monsters. Not great for low-light. All around clumsier than DSLR like D40. However, the video is fan-freakin-tastic, and the stereo audio (from on-camera mic, of all things) is even better. Shockingly good video and audio. Puts everything as simple files; you plug into USB and move the files onto HD for editing, etc. Very nice overall. Would buy another in a moment, except I know better will be available for cheaper soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Toxi Com

customer_reviews.title: Need repair less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Pro: small and takes pretty good picture. Con: Camera broke after nine months. We were in Hong Kong when the shutter could not open. The camera said "shutter error". We could not take any pictures. We went to Nikon Service Center in Hong Kong and was told that the warranty services did not extend outside of US. The cost of fixing the camera was estimated to be $155. Fortunately, we brought another camera with us for the trip. We got our camera repaired under warranty after we got home.
customer_reviews.author: Kityi

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera.  Highly Recommend this one.
customer_reviews.text: I'v had it for a while now. Decided to put in my review. So far, I'v been very impressed with quality of photos especially in daylight. Night and indoor pictures can be tricky. Take some settings adjustments, but that is expected. Has limited flash range, and limited exposure for indoor pics. But is managable for portraits with still objects. Outdoor in daylight is really where it shines. Very equivalent results compared to my full Nikon SLR D5100.
customer_reviews.author: Lion

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Nikon is one camera you Expect to be well built. For a very small camera it takes good photos. I'm afraid I'm spoiled by full image SLR cameras, and in unfair comparison, the images on the Nikon were not of the same resolution and color quality. It took a few days to adjust my thinking to accept that the small size is what I want, and willing to sacrifice image quality a little bit, for the several important benefits of this quite good camera.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Runser

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been very happy with this camera. The fit and finish are typical Nikon quality. Higher quality Nikon's are never very cheap but for me always worth the money. I just don't want to have to buy another on in a year. I also have a Nikon D80 Digital SLR that kicks butt!! It's too big and bulky to carry around for every day use. The P330 fits the need perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Would have loved to have a bigger display screen
customer_reviews.text: Sharp pictures. Impressed with the low light capability. Almost as close as my DSLR. Ample shot configuration via auto presets as well as some options. Would have loved to have a bigger display screen, or one with swiveling capability. Adequate flash for indoor and night shot settings. Sturdy and slips easily into pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Venkatarama

customer_reviews.title: Super quality camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera, but I had thought that the newer version, the P340, would be just as great, but with the addition of wifi. As it turns out, at least in my opinion, this has a tad more clearer, sharper images than the P340, so that's why I kept this one. I highly recommend it as the wifi is a minor sacrifice to give up for consistently crispier images.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Just took this camera through ASIA and Europe with me. I don't know s*** about cameras and used a phone cam before this so take it with a grain of salt. Very happy with camera. Auto mode does the job and takes great pics. No blurry issues, fast response time, good enough build quality. Would recommend for average user.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Nice pocket camera...
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. The main reason for purchase was the ability of the camera to save picture files in the "Raw" format. I currently have a 64 gb card in it and the camera has been serving me well. Takes good video also.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, excellent macro for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, excellent macro for the price, but the refurbished one i purchased has a problem with the card reader just not reconizing any card whenever it wants. started happening after the 90 day warranty and Nikon no longer makes parts so i cant even get it fixed. now im stuck with a brick.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Loving this Nikon...
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera for quality picture taking and size. Very easy to use and takes professional photos. I like to take my camera everywhere and this is the perfect size. It's a great first camera to explore with before investing in a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine King

customer_reviews.title: Nikon P330
customer_reviews.text: Wow what an amazing camera, it is a small P7700 (that I also have) it can go into your shirt or pants pocket, it is full of advanced features including RAW, HDR,
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! All the features I need in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera! All the features I need in a compact, light package. Could call it a digital version of an older Leica film camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: What a camera
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the camera a short time but am really impressed with all the features and marvel at the detail of almost any type photo situation. The low light feature is outstanding and will be very helpful in museums and other venues where flash is not allowed. Overall I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Neal S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use camera with a good picture BUT it ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use camera with a good picture BUT it isn't the best camera. It is slow and lacking a lot of features. It is good for minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: haven't really got to get into it as much as I will but so far I have been totally satisfied with the performance of this camera
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: very good camera but...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert but I was looking for a camera with a good picture quality and GPS built in. The pictures of Coolpix P330 are great especially with night shots , I would like to give it 5 stars but the only thing that bothered me is the GPS signal receiver , it takes too long time to find the signal outdoor and impossible to find it indoor. I tried to update the GPS file inside the camera nut nothing changed.
customer_reviews.author: Z@@K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I give this camera 5 stars because it's compact, easy to carry and takes amazing pictures at night. Does everything I expect and more!
customer_reviews.author: J Lee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: If you're wanting a really nice point and shoot camera that will take amazing photos even in low light all while fitting in your pocket, then this is the camera for you. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stoker

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera for the money. Has lots of features, but as an amateur, it is easy to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bean

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: As backups to my front line Nikons, the P300 and P310s fulfill an important role. Apart from their advantage in size, in art museums, where accurate color balance is important, they commonly outperform the full-size cameras in their auto white balance. This P330 has several (unadvertised) advancements over the P310, making it easily worth the money. I also just bought the P340 which should be better still. I wish I'd bought them on release, and I wish someone did a better job of identifying all the advancements each new model offers --- perhaps I'll write an update to specify...
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Does what a basic little point and shoot should. Good size. Great picture quality. Only downside is that it eats up batteries so order a couple extra
customer_reviews.author: Bob Trabucco

customer_reviews.title: quality of the pictures by this camera are so great
customer_reviews.text: i have high-bride, mirrorless camera which is over 700bucks, but this camera, nikon one is almost as good as my fancy mirrorless camera.. i just love it! light, easy to carry around and pictures are just great. satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Hwajin Lee

customer_reviews.title: easy to use -good for its size - motion pictures ...
customer_reviews.text: easy to use -good for its size - motion pictures so so
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Hamburger

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Handles and feels awesome. Look and size are great for the quality and options. Takes beautiful photo's and super easy to use. I have always used a Canon Powershot, but the transition was seamless. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Starla D Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Nikon coolpix P330
customer_reviews.text: I find it well made, easy to get nice sharp pics for my wife. It works well for her on auto, and good for me with plenty of features to keep me happy. The Wasabi batteries and charger make life easy..Also got a 16gb San Disk. Its all good.... Don
customer_reviews.author: Donald Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Still checking it out
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Going to use it for digiscoping. Still setting it up with a mechanical shutter release. One star off for not having a remote shutter release, but, knew that going in, so maybe it should only be a 1/2 star off. Takes good pics through the scope when there is no movement associated with the taking of the picture. Will start to get the "Dawn" test in another week or so when the weather gets a bit better around here.
customer_reviews.author: ex-enguneer

customer_reviews.title: Much liked.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot and will like it more when I learn to use all of its features. Takes good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: G. Facaros

customer_reviews.title: ruined all pictures from the trip of a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Worst camera I have ever purchased. Bought it 1 month prior to the trip of a lifetime-125 mile trek in the Himalayan mountains of Bhutan. Tried it out about 5 times before we left. About 2 days into the trip it started to malfunction. Half of the picture was tinted bluish with a line dividing the bluish tint from the remainder of the picture. All pictures were ruined. While I have some shots from friends I was with it is not the same! I was gone for a month so I can't return it and have had problems finding out how to repair it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Saladin

customer_reviews.title: excellwnt Buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small camera. I now feel safe ro leave my big camera at hime and take this one and still get quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: John Morodore

customer_reviews.title: Great Consumer Buy
customer_reviews.text: After looking in the Consumer Reports for a new camera I came along this one. It was number one on the list.It was a good price so I bought it. It takes a little time to learn about the choices and setting up but then it's easy to use. I love my camera.
customer_reviews.author: jfajardo

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA BASED ON CONSUMER REPORTS REVIEW. IT HAS MET MOST OF THE REQUIERMENTS . ITS PICTURE QUALITY IS BETTER THAN THE CANNON 110 HS THAT IT IS REPLACING. I HAD TO GLUE A RISER ON THE ON/OFF BUTTON SINCE IT WAS TOO SMALL FOR MY THUMB
customer_reviews.author: DFESS

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary charging cable
customer_reviews.text: The little fact that a special charging cable is needed to recharge the battery has become a major annoyance over time. It uses a generic USB charger but the cable doesn't have a micro-USB plug but a plug that looks nearly identical but is incompatible. This means you'll need to carry a dedicated cable just to charge the camera. Had I known how annoying this got I would have picked the Canon over the Nikon. Otherwise the camera is a fine P&S camera. I ended up never using the GPS feature mainly because it would just drain the batteries unnecessarily.
customer_reviews.author: Claus

customer_reviews.title: Great features but slowest running camera ever
customer_reviews.text: Great features but slowest running camera ever. Takes forever to process mode changes and autofocus. There is a better product out there. I take 400+ pictures a week for work and needed a good compact. But I wish I had returned this one and tried another.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera..my favorite is the 1.8 aperture...I captured some awesome night pics in Bora Bora!! Great weight and size..just all around good point and shoot. Coolpix' are great!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Best in the business!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for home photography, outside, trips and meetings. Excellent pictures and options
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera!
customer_reviews.text: Many features such as panorama view in 180 and 360, pet shots, special low light settings, and easy to use buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Deakyne

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just loved the camera. It's the greater pocket camera I've ever seen. The battery doesnt last long. So, I suggest you to take another batery, besides the original.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Khoury Francisco Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Consumer reports was right.
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera. I haven't used the flash yet because it takes great pix without it. Almost in total darkness.
customer_reviews.author: roy gagnon

customer_reviews.title: nice camera but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: It is a good camera but a bit heavy. I like to carry my camera in my purse. Takes good pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Piedlow

customer_reviews.title: Nikon COOLPIX P330
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, great pictures, fairly easy wifi upload. I am kinda rough on cameras and I dropped it off the sofa onto the extended lens which broke the lens off. So now I have to see if I can get it repaired and maybe give it to my (grown) children. In the meantime I have just bought a Panasonic Lumix "Tough" camera that is waterproof, shockproof, and (hopefully) me-proof!
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but not excellent colors
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a bit this winter and spring, but don't like the colors in the photos as well as the Canon S110 that I had been using, so I use that most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: five out of five stars
customer_reviews.text: fantastic product. highly recommended! professional photographer are using the nicon P330. have seen photos made with NICON P330 before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Geiger

customer_reviews.title: not worth the trouble nor the price
customer_reviews.text: after just 4 months flash doesnt work and know its left up to the recipian to send it back to nikon for repairs and charges unknown until they test it.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Caban

customer_reviews.title: Focus lacks in low-light (returned)
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I've only had it for an hour - but I have been trying it out on various subjects that are still and moving, in both well lit and poorly lit rooms. I'm disappointed to say that it doesn't focus very well when available light is low. I'm a pro photographer looking for a decent quality point & shoot for when I don't want to lug my big camera around. I feel like I'm probably going to send this back but I'll take another day to play. Disappointed. UPDATE I returned the camera. The focus was ridiculously horrible and unacceptable. Focused on exactly what I didn't want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Rayray

customer_reviews.title: not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: returned this camera, was not fast at all and the pictures were still a little fuzzy. I would not recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: of the fact that an SD card is NOT included with this camera. It is essential (you can only take 2 pix with the camera's internal memory) and it is standard practice to include one with a camera. So add c. $25 to any advertised price that you see here. Camera itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: S.M. Poulos

customer_reviews.title: It is defective, how do I return it
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the lens gets condensation inside on damp days. The pictures have a round white area. We would like to exchange the camera immediately. The camera is good but this one is defective.
customer_reviews.author: joe atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Beware, no memory card in package.  What good is a camera without a memory card?  Nikon cutting expenses?
customer_reviews.text: Have a memory card handy. Did not include one with purchase. So far, no other problems. Received Satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera. features and imaging, easy to use, gps feature also nice (metadata integration). small and compact, recommende
customer_reviews.text: excellent camera. features and imaging, easy to use, gps feature also nice (metadata integration). small and compact, recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Perspectech

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX P330 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 5x Zoom (Black) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackFROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



 Pocket-sized performance that's anything but small.
Proving that looks can be deceiving, the streamlined COOLPIX P330 offers the outstanding image quality, low-light capabilities and cutting-edge technology of a COOLPIX Advanced Performance camera in a highly portable design. Comfortably bring it everywhere and create photos and videos you'll cherish for a lifetime. Make your friends and family look great against softly blurred backgrounds. Reveal the warm ambience of a low-light scene around the dinner table. Capture a fleeting moment as a dazzling Full HD 1080p video. You can even share your wonderful shots immediately—and take pictures remotely—with Nikon's optional Wi-Fi accessory and a compatible smartphone or tablet*. For those seeking exceptional performance in a sleek, small camera, the COOLPIX P330 delivers. 






SUPERIOR LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE
HIGH-PERFORMANCE CMOS IMAGE SENSOR LETS YOU SHOOT WITHOUT A FLASH
Imagine being able to shoot without a flash at weddings, concerts, parties—anywhere your flash normally fires. You won't have to interrupt a moment to capture it, and your photos and HD videos will look more natural and true to your memory. The COOLPIX P330 performs so well in low light situations that, in most cases, using the flash is optional. Of course, when the lighting is extremely poor and you need a flash, it'll be there.

ANYTIME ANYWHERE SHARING
THE WU-1A WIRELESS MOBILE ADAPTER LETS YOU SHARE TO A COMPATIBLE SMARTPHONE OR TABLET
Use your compatible smartphone or tablet to instantly upload your shots to the web or email them to a friend. Or, remotely control the COOLPIX P330—see what the camera sees from your smartphone or tablet and fire off shots! Connect the optional WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter and wirelessly transfer photos to your smartphone, tablet or any compatible Wi-Fi enabled device.

RECORD SUPERIOR VIDEOS
1080P FULL HD VIDEOS WITH STEREO SOUND FOR DAZZLING MOVIES
If you want a compact camera that shoots stunning Full HD videos, the COOLPIX P330 delivers. 1080p Full HD means exceptional video quality. Record the action, then use an optional HDMI cable to connect to an HDTV and watch your videos come alive. A built-in mic records high-quality audio in stereo. Your videos will look and sound phenomenal. 





TAKE CONTROL OF YOUR VISION
FULL MANUAL CONTROL AND RAW (NEF) CAPABILITY FOR ADDITIONAL FLEXIBILITY
The COOLPIX P330 takes exceptional images on its own, but when you want to take control, you can. Select from Program, Shutter Priority, Aperture Priority or Manual mode and bring your vision to life. For those who want to record the purest, unmodified versions of their photos, the COOLPIX P330 can record in RAW (NRW) mode.



PREMIUM ACCESSORIES
WU-1a Wireless Mobile Adapter 
Using the WU-1a optional wireless mobile adapter you can now automatically send great images to your smartphone and even use your smartphone to remotely capture images from your P330. With an easy to use app, now when you can't wait to share that great shot you don't have to. Share it to your smartphone in a instant. EN-EL12 Rechargeable Li-Ion Battery 
The EN-EL12 is a rechargeable Li-ion battery providing 3.7v and 1050 mAh of power to select Nikon COOLPIX digital cameras.
feature_bullets: Wi-Fi capable with WU-1a adapter (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars106 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
